data.title: AngelScript should define AS_NO_THREADS ?
data.body:
Since the scripts are always executed in the main thread and no multi-threading seems to be performed via scripts. Should `AS_NO_THREADS` be defined at compile time? According to the documentation this should increase the performance by a bit.

Should I make a pull request for this or is it the intended behavior?

Adding essential options for fullscreen in multimonitor environment. 
Tested on Windows 10 with DX9, DX11 and OpenGL renderers.

data.title: Disable Visual Studio warnings for third party
[Feature request] script library
data.body:
Sorry to bother you with minor things, but it is second-most-annoying problem for me
in Urho. I don't know which solution is the best, but having to specify always
```c++
#include "Scripts/path1/libpath2/someotherpath/script.as"
```
is a bit (quite a bit) annoying, because if I want to move script I will have to change
its path in many places.
Specifying
```c++
 #include "somepath/script.as"
```
where somepath is under current script path is not reliable and sometimes magic things happen,
and that is not really documented, probably some side-effect.
What I want is either to use C-way (use current script dir as default
for include but be able to specify a set of paths for scripts) or be able to specify
include path by hand. And yes, I want it to work with .pak's too, so it should be
resource-manager agnostic. I don't think the thing is too complicated to implement,
or probably there is some helper I'm not aware of?

fix doc example
data.body:
Hi, recently I find a bug in doc's example of CMakeLists.txt file:
https://urho3d.github.io/documentation/1.6/_using_library.html

I guess need change this
```
# Include Urho3D Cmake common module
include (Urho3D-CMake-common)
```
to this
```
# Include Urho3D Cmake common module
include (UrhoCommon)
```

Mouse events not working on Sierra
data.body:
I am having issues with Mouse events on Sierra. They are not working when I use the open command which opens a new terminal. It looks like it might be related to SDL. To reproduce build the latest Urho3D from master and run 25_Urho2DParticle a few times until it doesn't react to the input.
`open 25_Urho2DParticle`

data.title: Compiling option -DURHO3D_SSE=1 apparently not being honored on Debian 8.7 (amd64)
data.body:
Hello,

While compiling Urho3D 1.6 on Debian 8.7 (amd64) I noticed that, after running cmake, the `-DURHO3D_SSE=1` option apparently wasn't being honored.

```
./cmake_generic.sh . -DURHO3D_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=generic -DURHO3D_SSE=1
[...]
--  CFLAGS:        -ffast-math -pthread -fdiagnostics-color=auto
--  EXTRA_CFLAGS:  -Wshadow -Wall
--  EXTRA_LDFLAGS: -Wl,--no-undefined
--  EXTRA_LIBS:    rt;m;dl;GL
[...]
```
I had to `export CFLAGS="-msse -msse2"` to it to be added.

```
export CFLAGS="-msse -msse2"
./cmake_generic.sh . -DURHO3D_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=generic -DURHO3D_SSE=1
[...]
--  CFLAGS:        -msse -msse2  -ffast-math -pthread -fdiagnostics-color=auto
--  EXTRA_CFLAGS:  -Wshadow -Wall 
--  EXTRA_LDFLAGS: -Wl,--no-undefined
--  EXTRA_LIBS:    rt;m;dl;GL
[...]
```

The same happens on `cmake_mingw.sh`.

This, however, doesn't happen on Debian 8.7 (i386).

Since I'm new to Urho3D I'm not sure if that's intended or not, so I'm reporting it just in case. Please correct me if I'm wrong.

Best regards.

data.title: ReinsertToOctree code path slows down over time
data.body:
Following histogram displays how much [ReinsertToOctree](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/master/Source/Urho3D/Graphics/Octree.cpp#L455-L481) code block takes on android (galaxy s5). This is about 13 minutes of data. As you can see from the picture not too long after start it begins killing framerate and it gets only worse.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19151258/23834036/5bea483a-0747-11e7-943d-2473dc98db1b.png)

My test scene is very simple - up to 10 objects move across the screen rotating randomly. Triangle count is stable (3.5k), batch count stable as well (about 20, goes up to 30 sometimes). One thing to note - on pc batch count is about 10 for very same scene (if it is of any relevance). Memory usage reported by debug hud is also stable.

This also seems to be happening on PC, although at much slower rate (also about 13 minutes of data) and has much less of an impact:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19151258/23834187/1381fe3c-074a-11e7-8d57-a7fbc0b564bc.png)

Edit: turns out issue was my fault, sorry for the noise.

data.title: Fix jumping slider knob when it's size is fixed.
data.body: Slider has a feature where setting min and max size of knob allows us to control it's size. However when knob size is enlarged moving know causes it to jump forward and back. This change fixes the issue.

data.title: Improve Box2D integration
PODVector::RemoveSwap() doesn't compile
ParticleEmitter has a bug.
Building fails with the latest update of MSYS2's MinGW-W64
data.body:
The build crashes when building with the latest `MSYS2`/`MinGW` or `MSYS2`/`MinGW-W64` (`g++-6.3.0`). Not Urho's fault, though, because it fails when building SDL2 XInput (`Source\ThirdParty\SDL\src\core\windows\SDL_xinput.h`) due to the double definition of `XINPUT_GAMEPAD_EX` and `XINPUT_STATE_EX` inside both SDL2 and MinGW headers, which does not happen when building with earlier versions of `MinGW`. 

It can be easily fixed by either re-naming the definition on either side (to `XINPUT_GAMEPAD_EX2`, for example). 

Seems like others also experienced this as well: https://github.com/rdp/ffmpeg-windows-build-helpers/issues/204 

![](http://i.imgur.com/lvPp44w.jpg)

data.title: An unhandled exception occured.
data.body:
Hi,
I download the sample project from [xamarin website (this link)](https://developer.xamarin.com/guides/cross-platform/urho/introduction/)
then I added 

```
var surface= UrhoSurface.CreateSurface<Sample>(this);
 layout.AddView(surface);
SetContentView(layout);
```
to MainActivity.cs

But when I run it in my AVD, the app opens with title "Urho3d" and in 1 or 2 seconds, an error gets displayed (while debugging in debug mode)
"An unhandled exception occured."

regards
Dhilip

data.title: Missing licenses in bin/
data.body:
Hello, I've noticed that there are no license headers or files for almost everything in "bin/" and its subdirectories(for instance, see the shaders). 

I also cannot find anywhere the licensing information for the art/sounds/texture assets.

I think it would be useful to have them in place.

data.title: Advanced terrain material
data.body:
Today, Urho only supports 3 textures for terrain splat-mapping. It looks good for simplistic landscapes, specially if the camera is distant from it. However, for first person and third person perspectives, it can be really problematic. It would be nice to have support for advanced terrain materials in Urho's terrain. Something not so advanced or cutting edge, just a little more versatile. UDK's Terrain is a good example:

https://docs.unrealengine.com/udk/Three/TerrainAdvancedTextures.html

Or Unity's multi-material support:

http://www.bitsalive.com/how-to-create-awesome-terrains-in-unity/

data.title: Add info about shapes to PhysicsEvents2D
data.body:
Sometimes it is necessary to identify collided shapes: http://www.iforce2d.net/b2dtut/jumpability

Can we also add to components name_, tags or vars? (currently I compare pointers to identify shape)

EDIT: May be move "name", "vars" and "tags" to Animatable (or Serializable) class?
